parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Silviu Coșa, a PNL candidate for the Romanian Senate.  This directly refers to a candidate participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, aiming to reach a wide audience. The reach estimate is 100K-500K, further supporting this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post presents itself as an interview, the subject matter focuses on a candidate's plans as a future parliamentarian. This strongly suggests an electoral objective to positively influence voters' perception of the candidate and potentially increase votes for him.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement further strengthens this argument.  It aims to promote the candidate and his party (PNL) indirectly, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The format resembles a news interview. However, the selection of the interviewee (a candidate) and the focus on his future plans as a parliamentarian strongly suggest a bias towards promoting the candidate, exceeding the boundaries of objective journalism as defined in Article 36 (7) - d.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured interview promoting a political candidate.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>864861295517511</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while presented as an interview, functions as electoral propaganda. It fulfills all criteria of Article 36 (7): it refers directly to a candidate (Silviu Coșa), is published during the electoral period (though the exact date isn't specified, the ad archive suggests it was active around June 2023), has a clear electoral objective (promoting the candidate), and likely exceeds the limits of objective journalism by focusing on the candidate's plans as a future parliamentarian. The paid nature of the post on a public platform further reinforces its propagandistic intent.  The counter-argument could be that it's simply reporting on a candidate's statements, but the context and the paid nature strongly suggest an intention to influence voters.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Silviu Coșa</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Tomis Tv, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 864861295517511) care promovează candidatul PNL la Senat, Silviu Coșa, prezentându-i planurile ca viitor parlamentar.  Această postare, deși mascată sub forma unui interviu, îndeplinește toate criteriile materialului de propagandă electorală conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334/2006, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat.  Efectul electoral este clar, vizând creșterea popularității și a voturilor pentru Silviu Coșa.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
